channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT

item.title: Report X-2024031409
item.description:
Report X-2024031409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: OREM
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN OREM, UTAH, AN AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THERMAL TRACKING LABEL BEING PARTIALLY TORN AND ILLEGIBLE WITH SIGNS OF PREVIOUS MARKS REMOVED. PACKAGE OPENED TO FIND NINE IPADS IN OTTER BOXES WITH CHARGING CORDS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS A RED FRAGILE STICKER APPLIED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNLOADED AND SENT OVERHEAD SORTER, DAMAGED OUTTER BOX CAUSING THE LID TO BECOME LOOSE AND LEAK CORROSIVE SOLID. PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP CAUSED BY SENDING IT OVER HEAD SORTER DAMAGING THE OUTTER BOX SOILING ALL CONTENTS INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024031041
item.description:
Report X-2024031041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: OREM
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO (2) PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT PRODUCTS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1Z85E85Y0217815894. THE OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS AND PERISHABLE. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SEVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM UTAH USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 85E85Y, WASATCH WAGYU, 30661 OLD LINCOLN HWY, COALVILLE UT 84017-9611.

item.title: Report E-2024030498
item.description:
Report E-2024030498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of KEM 400 Enamel Omaha Orange High Gloss released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading (it was double stacked, and freight crushed it). The release impacted the trailer floor and one other 5-gallon metal pail of product. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report X-2024031036
item.description:
Report X-2024031036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: Salt Lake City
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipping container EMHU 643693 leaking in the rail yard. Inspection showed 2 5 gallon buckets leaked a total of .5 gallon each of material. No blocking and bracing present. Crew decontaminated container and over packed the two breached 5 gallon buckets then repackaged and blocked the remaining buckets.
